unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Intense Competition in Data Plan Offerings**
normalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Intense Competition in Data Plan Offerings**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – The Indian telecommunications market is witnessing a fierce battle for subscriber acquisition and retention, driven by increasingly competitive data plan offerings. Jio, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea are aggressively revising their data plans, with many now offering unlimited data packages at lower price points.
normalised: Mumbai, twenty-sixth October two thousand and twenty three – The Indian telecommunications market is witnessing a fierce battle for subscriber acquisition and retention, driven by increasingly competitive data plan offerings. J I O, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea are aggressively revising their data plans, with many now offering unlimited data packages at lower price points.

unnormalised: This surge in affordability is attributed to the falling cost of infrastructure and the increasing consumption of online content, fueled partly by the popularity of streaming services and Bollywood films like "Pathaan" which saw record viewership.
normalised: This surge in affordability is attributed to the falling cost of infrastructure and the increasing consumption of online content, fueled partly by the popularity of streaming services and Bollywood films like "Pathaan" which saw record viewership.

unnormalised: According to a recent report by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI), data consumption has risen by over 40% in the last year. The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi is also conducting research on optimising network performance to handle this exponential growth.
normalised: According to a recent report by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I), data consumption has risen by over forty percent in the last year. The Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Delhi is also conducting research on optimising network performance to handle this exponential growth.

unnormalised: Analysts predict that this price war will continue, benefiting consumers with access to cheaper and more abundant data. Some analysts however fear that smaller companies offering localized networks could face setbacks in the long run. Many now have started demanding a more regulated framework for the distribution of data plans.
normalised: Analysts predict that this price war will continue, benefiting consumers with access to cheaper and more abundant data. Some analysts however fear that smaller companies offering localized networks could face setbacks in the long run. Many now have started demanding a more regulated framework for the distribution of data plans.
